footerFootnote: "jora.dev" Skills Radar represents common used technologies, tools, instruments and helps at its distribution in level on usage. This Technology Radar is based on https://github.com/AOEpeople/aoe_technology_radar.

paragraphs.headline: Introduction
values: Technology is moving fast and new technologies and innovations appear continuously.

Throughout my journey in this industry over the years, I've had the opportunity to explore a wide array of technologies and tools. Some technologies become obsolete and disappear in history, while others I've bid farewell to as my career took new directions. Among the vast landscape of tech, there's a core set of technologies I've come to master with confidence, wielding them to develop software and operate it for robust production systems. On the flip side, I use some other technologies rarely, or only a few times for simple pet or educational projects. Over time, it becomes relevant for myself to observe my current technology stack, reflecting on the arsenal of knowledge I possess now, as well as the various technologies I've explored at some point along the way.
Let's track it out with me!

paragraphs.headline: How should it be used
values: The radar acts as an overview of technologies that I have used more than once.
I group or categorize the items in 4 quadrants - (sometimes, when it's not 100% clear where a item belongs, so I choose the best fit).

quadrants.name: Backend Dev & Databases
quadrants.description: I've placed backend development languages and frameworks (such as Java or Spring Framework) here. There are also storage systems and other integral part of tools for backend development such as Swagger or Test utils

quadrants.name: WebDev & Frontent
quadrants.description: Here I put information on tools for building UI and simple websites. You can find here frontend frameworks as well as different useful CMS and headless-CMS tools.

quadrants.name: Operations
quadrants.description: This quadrant clusters technologies around the operation of software and infrastructure related platforms, tools and services.

quadrants.name: Tools
quadrants.description: Here I put common software tools and small helpers. Also this quadrant is used to place uncategorized technologies.

rings.name: Adopt
rings.description: I have used this technology for longer period of time in many projects and I have confidence in it.

rings.name: Trial
rings.description: Here I have placed technologies that I started using recently or are actively studying. Or technologies that were used only in pet projects.

rings.name: Rarely
rings.description: This quadrant contains technologies that I have used either rarely, or once, or for a long time ago(so much so that my knowledge may lose its relevance, but at the same time I remain at a low threshold for entering it again). Also I think that I do not have serious experience and knowledge of the pitfalls of this technology.

rings.name: Hold
rings.description: This category is a bit special. It contains a set of technologies that I stopped using and studying for various reasons.
